title: Google
content: I met a man [who|which|whose|where] works at Google. This is the book [that|who|whose|where] I read yesterday. That is the girl [whose|who|which|that] brother is famous. The cafe [where|which|who|whose] we met is closing. The phone, [which|who|that|whose] I bought yesterday, is broken. The person [who|which|whose|where] called you is waiting.

explanation-en-US:
# ðŸ”— The Man Who... (Relative Clauses)

Relative pronouns link details to the noun.

1. **[who]**: For people.
2. **[that]**: For things (identifying).
3. **[whose]**: For possession (her brother).
4. **[where]**: For places.
5. **[which]**: For things (extra info with comma).
6. **[who]**: For people.

title: Man
content: The man [who|which] called is here. The girl [who|which] runs fast won.

title: Car
content: The car [which|who] crashed is red. The book [which|who] I read is good.

title: Dog
content: The dog [that|who] bites is scary. The pen [that|who] works is mine. (That can replace Which/Who in defining clauses).

title: Whose
content: The boy [whose|who] bike was stolen is sad. The woman [whose|who] car is blue is my mom.

title: Park
content: The park [where|which] we played is big. The house [where|that] I live is old.

title: Day
content: The day [when|where] we met was rainy. The year [when|which] I was born was 1990.

title: Commas
content: My dad, [who|that] is 50, is a doctor. (Commas = Who, no That). The city, [which|that] is big, is noisy.

title: Object
content: The man [-|who] I saw was tall. The movie [-|which] we watched was fun. (Object pronoun can be omitted).

title: One
content: He is the one [who|which] did it. She is the one [that|what] helped me.

title: Man
content: The man [who| -] lives next door. The bus [which| -] goes to city.

title: Chair
content: The chair [on which|which on] I sat. The person [to whom|who to] I spoke.

title: Reason
content: The reason [why|which] I came. The reason [that|which] I left.

title: Want
content: I know [what|that] you did. This is [what|which] I want.

title: Everything
content: All [that|what] glitters is not gold. Everything [that|what] he said is true.

title: Teacher
content: The teacher [who|which] taught me was kind.

title: Computer
content: The computer [which|who] broke is new.

title: Whose
content: I have a friend [whose|who] brother is a singer.

title: Cafe
content: This is the cafe [where|which] we met.

title: Remember
content: I remember the day [when|where] we first met.

title: Mother
content: My mother, [who|that] is a nurse, works hard.

title: House
content: The house in [which|that] I grew up.

title: Boy
content: I know a boy [who|whose] speaks five languages.

title: Lost
content: I lost the pen [which|who] you gave me.

title: Whose
content: The house [whose|which] roof is red is mine.

title: School
content: The school [where|that] I study is big.

title: Summer
content: Summer is the season [when|where] it is hot.

title: London
content: London, [which|that] is the capital, is huge.

title: Whom
content: The person with [whom|who] I spoke.

title: Woman
content: The woman [who|which] lives here is famous.

title: Cake
content: The cake [which|who] she baked was delicious.

title: Whose
content: He helped the man [whose|who] car broke down.

title: Visited
content: I visited the town [where|which] I was born.

title: Year
content: The year [when|which] he graduated was 2020.

title: Painting
content: This painting, [which|that] is old, costs a lot.

title: Topic
content: The topic about [which|that] we argued.

title: Actor
content: He is the actor [who|which] won the award.

title: Saw
content: We saw a movie [which|who] was very scary.

title: Whose
content: The cat [whose|which] eyes are blue is cute.

title: Hotel
content: The hotel [where|that] we stayed was nice.

title: Time
content: Tell me the time [when|where] the train leaves.

title: Smith
content: Mr. Smith, [who|that] is our neighbor, likes gardening.

title: Tools
content: The tools with [which|who] he fixed the car.

title: People
content: The people [who|whose] work here are friendly.

title: Letter
content: The letter [which|who] arrived today is important.

title: Whose
content: Do you know the girl [whose|who] phone this is?

title: Let
content: Let's go to the park [where|which] we played soccer.

title: Moment
content: There was a moment [when|where] I felt happy.

title: Titanic
content: The Titanic, [which|that] sank in 1912, was a big ship.

title: Whom
content: The friends to [whom|who] I wrote letters.
